Beelia Terms of Service

Last updated: December 31st, 2025

These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern your access to and use of the Beelia website, platform, applications, and related services (collectively, the "Platform"). Please read these Terms carefully. By accessing, browsing, or using Beelia in any manner, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree with any part of these Terms, you must not use the Platform.

1. Legal Entity and Platform Operator

Beelia is currently operated as an internal product of Cesno Innovation S.L., a company incorporated and registered in Spain. All references to "Beelia," "we," "us," or "our" refer to Cesno Innovation S.L. and its successors, affiliates, or assigns.

Beelia may, at a later stage, be incorporated as a separate legal entity. In such case, ownership and control may remain with Cesno Innovation S.L., and these Terms shall continue to apply unless expressly replaced or amended.

2. Purpose of the Platform

Beelia is an open, platform-agnostic marketplace designed to facilitate the discovery, access, and commercialization of artificial intelligence tools and services created by independent third parties ("Creators").

Beelia provides infrastructure, discovery, and transactional facilitation. Beelia does not, by default, develop, own, operate, or control third-party AI tools unless explicitly stated otherwise.

3. Eligibility and Age Requirements

3.1 Using Beelia

Beelia is intended to be accessible to a broad audience. Anyone may browse, access, and use the Platform, regardless of age, provided they comply with these Terms and applicable laws.

If you are under the age of majority in your jurisdiction, you represent that you have obtained permission from a parent or legal guardian to use the Platform.

3.2 Publishing and Monetizing Tools

To publish, list, sell, or otherwise monetize AI tools on Beelia, you must be at least 18 years old or the age of majority in your jurisdiction.

3.3 Underage Creators

Individuals under the age of 18 may publish tools only through an account owned, verified, and legally controlled by a parent, legal guardian, or other responsible adult. In such cases, the adult account holder:

  • Is deemed the legal creator and account owner;
  • Must complete any required identity, tax, or payment verification;
  • Assumes full legal, financial, and regulatory responsibility for the listed tools;
  • Is responsible for payouts, taxes, and compliance obligations.

Beelia reserves the right to request verification to confirm compliance with these requirements.

4. Accounts and Registration

4.1 Account Creation

Certain features of the Platform require the creation of an account. When creating an account, you agree to provide information that is accurate, complete, and kept up to date. You may not impersonate another person or entity, create accounts on behalf of others without authorization, or provide misleading information.

4.2 Account Responsibility and Security

You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login credentials and for all activities that occur under your account, whether authorized or unauthorized. Beelia is not responsible for any loss or damage arising from unauthorized access caused by your failure to secure your credentials.

You agree to notify Beelia immediately if you suspect unauthorized access, misuse, or a security breach related to your account.

4.3 Account Restrictions

Beelia reserves the right to limit, suspend, or terminate accounts that:

  • Violate these Terms or applicable laws;
  • Pose security, fraud, or abuse risks;
  • Are inactive for extended periods;
  • Are used in a manner that harms the Platform or other users.

5. Role and Responsibility of Beelia (Important)

Beelia acts as an independent marketplace and platform facilitator for AI tools created and operated by third parties. Beelia is not the developer or operator of third-party tools unless explicitly stated otherwise.

5.1 Verification, Safety, and Trust

Trust and safety are core principles of the Beelia Platform. Beelia maintains a robust and evolving verification framework designed to reduce risk, protect users, and maintain platform integrity.

As part of this framework, Beelia may:

  • Verify creator identity and eligibility;
  • Review tools prior to publication;
  • Re-review tools upon updates or material changes;
  • Monitor tools over time;
  • Investigate and act upon user reports or risk signals;
  • Suspend, restrict, or remove tools that fail to meet safety, quality, or policy standards.

Verification is an ongoing process, not a one-time event.

5.2 Scope and Limitations of Verification

While Beelia invests significant effort into making the Platform as safe and trustworthy as reasonably possible, you acknowledge and agree that:

  • Verification processes may evolve over time as the Platform scales and new risks emerge;
  • No verification system can guarantee that a tool is completely free from defects, vulnerabilities, or misuse;
  • Beelia does not provide formal certifications, legal guarantees, or warranties regarding third-party tools;
  • Ultimate responsibility for the design, operation, outputs, and legal compliance of tools remains with the Creator.

5.3 No Professional Advice

Beelia does not provide professional, legal, medical, financial, or regulatory advice. Any outputs generated by AI tools are provided for informational purposes only.

Beelia is not a party to agreements entered into directly between Users and Creators. Use of third-party tools is at the User's own discretion and subject to the Creator's applicable terms and disclosures.

6. Users

Users may browse, access, and subscribe to AI tools made available by Creators through the Platform. Users acknowledge and agree that:

  • AI tools may generate inaccurate, incomplete, biased, misleading, or harmful outputs;
  • AI-generated outputs should not be relied upon as professional, legal, medical, financial, or regulatory advice;
  • Users are solely responsible for evaluating outputs and determining their suitability for any purpose;
  • Users are responsible for complying with all applicable laws and regulations related to their use of AI tools.

Beelia does not monitor or control how Users apply or interpret AI-generated outputs and shall not be liable for decisions, actions, or consequences resulting from such use.

7. Creators

Creators may submit AI tools for listing on Beelia subject to review, verification, and ongoing compliance with these Terms and any additional platform policies.

Creators represent and warrant that:

  • They own or have the legal right to distribute, license, and monetize their tools;
  • Their tools comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and ethical standards;
  • Tool descriptions, pricing, and representations are accurate and not misleading;
  • Their tools do not infringe or misappropriate third-party rights;
  • They will maintain and update tools in a manner consistent with user expectations and platform standards.

Creators are responsible for:

  • Tool performance, maintenance, updates, and support;
  • Addressing vulnerabilities, bugs, or security issues in a timely manner;
  • Responding to user reports or complaints when required.

Beelia may remove, suspend, or restrict tools or creator accounts if they pose legal, security, trust, or reputational risk, or if they fail to meet evolving platform standards.

8. Payments, Fees, and Monetization

Beelia may facilitate payments, subscriptions, and other transactions between Users and Creators through third-party payment processors.

8.1 Pricing and Fees

Creators generally set their own pricing unless otherwise specified. Beelia may charge platform fees or commissions, which will be disclosed separately and may change over time.

8.2 Payouts and Processing

Payments and payouts are subject to the terms, verification requirements, and processing timelines of third-party payment providers. Beelia does not control delays, holds, chargebacks, or reversals imposed by such providers.

8.3 No Guarantees

Beelia does not guarantee income, usage, traffic, visibility, or financial success for any Creator.

8.4 Taxes

Creators are solely responsible for determining, reporting, and paying any taxes associated with their earnings. Beelia may provide transaction records but does not provide tax advice.

9. Intellectual Property

9.1 Platform IP

Beelia and Cesno Innovation S.L. retain all rights, title, and interest in the Platform, including software, interfaces, branding, design, and underlying technology.

9.2 Creator IP

Creators retain full ownership of their tools and related intellectual property. Listing a tool on Beelia does not transfer ownership to Beelia.

9.3 User Rights

Users receive only limited, revocable rights to access and use tools in accordance with applicable terms. No ownership rights are granted.

9.4 Feedback

Any feedback, suggestions, or ideas submitted to Beelia may be used by Beelia without obligation or compensation.

10. Acceptable Use Policy

You agree to use Beelia responsibly and in compliance with applicable laws. Prohibited activities include, but are not limited to:

  • Illegal, fraudulent, or deceptive activities;
  • Distribution of malware, spyware, or harmful code;
  • Attempts to exploit vulnerabilities or bypass safeguards;
  • Harassment, abuse, or misuse of the Platform or other users;
  • Use of tools in ways that violate rights, laws, or ethical standards.

Beelia reserves the right to investigate violations and take appropriate enforcement action.

11. Disclaimers

11.1 Platform and Tool Availability

The Platform and all third-party tools are provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. While Beelia aims to maintain a high-quality and reliable Platform, it does not guarantee that access will be uninterrupted, timely, secure, or error-free.

11.2 No Warranties

To the maximum extent permitted by law, Beelia expressly disclaims all warranties, whether express, implied, or statutory, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, accuracy, non-infringement, or reliability.

11.3 AI-Specific Risks

Users acknowledge that AI tools may produce inaccurate, incomplete, biased, misleading, or unexpected outputs. Beelia does not warrant that AI tools will achieve any particular outcome or be suitable for any specific use case.

12. Limitation of Liability

12.1 General Limitation

To the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, Beelia and Cesno Innovation S.L. shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, consequential, special, exemplary, or punitive damages, including but not limited to loss of profits, loss of data, loss of goodwill, or business interruption.

12.2 Third-Party Tools

Beelia shall not be liable for any damages arising from the use, inability to use, or reliance on third-party tools listed on the Platform, including damages caused by errors, omissions, security vulnerabilities, or misuse.

12.3 Maximum Liability

Where liability cannot be excluded, Beelia's total liability shall not exceed the amount paid by you to Beelia, if any, in the twelve (12) months preceding the event giving rise to the claim.

13. Indemnification

You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Beelia, Cesno Innovation S.L., and their affiliates, directors, officers, employees, and partners from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable legal fees) arising out of or related to:

  • Your use or misuse of the Platform;
  • Your violation of these Terms or applicable laws;
  • Your infringement of intellectual property or other rights of any third party;
  • Any tools you publish, list, or distribute through Beelia.

14. Suspension and Termination

14.1 Suspension

Beelia may temporarily suspend access to the Platform, specific tools, or accounts if it reasonably believes that:

  • These Terms have been violated;
  • Continued access poses security, legal, or reputational risk;
  • Suspension is required to comply with law or regulatory requests.

14.2 Termination

Beelia may terminate accounts or access permanently at its discretion, with or without notice, where permitted by law.

14.3 Effect of Termination

Termination does not relieve you of obligations incurred prior to termination, including payment obligations or liability for prior conduct.

15. Modifications to the Platform and Terms

15.1 Platform Changes

Beelia may modify, update, suspend, or discontinue any aspect of the Platform, including features, tools, or availability, at any time. Beelia shall not be liable for any modification or discontinuation of the Platform.

15.2 Changes to Terms

Beelia may update these Terms from time to time. Material changes will be communicated where required by law. Continued use of the Platform after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised Terms.

16. Governing Law and Jurisdiction

These Terms are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Spain, without regard to conflict of law principles.

Where permitted by law, any disputes arising out of or relating to these Terms or the Platform shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Spain. Mandatory consumer protection laws may grant additional rights.

17. Contact Information

For legal or support inquiries, please contact:

Email: support@beelia.ai

By using Beelia, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agreed to these Terms of Service.

policies.title: Policies
policies.content:
Beelia Privacy Policy

Last updated: December 31st, 2025

This Privacy Policy explains how Beelia, operated by Cesno Innovation S.L. ("Beelia," "we," "us," or "our"), collects, uses, stores, shares, and protects personal data when you access or use the Beelia website, platform, applications, and related services (collectively, the "Platform").

This Policy applies to all users of Beelia, including visitors, users, creators, and waitlist subscribers. By using Beelia, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy.

1. Who We Are

Beelia is currently operated as an internal product of Cesno Innovation S.L., a company incorporated and registered in Spain. For the purposes of data protection laws, Cesno Innovation S.L. acts as the data controller for personal data processed through the Platform.

If Beelia is later incorporated as a separate legal entity, data processing responsibilities may be transferred to that entity, subject to applicable law and appropriate notice.

2. Scope of This Policy

This Privacy Policy covers:

  • Personal data collected directly from you;
  • Data collected automatically when you use the Platform;
  • Data processed in connection with creator onboarding, verification, and monetization;
  • Data related to communications, support, and security.

It does not cover how third-party AI tools listed on Beelia process your data. Such processing is governed by the respective creator's privacy policies.

3. Personal Data We Collect

3.1 Data You Provide Directly

Depending on how you use Beelia, we may collect:

  • Name, username, or display name;
  • Email address;
  • Account credentials;
  • Waitlist information;
  • Creator onboarding information;
  • Identity verification information (for creators);
  • Payment-related details (processed via third-party providers);
  • Communications you send to us;
  • Feedback, reports, or support requests.

3.2 Data Collected Automatically

When you access the Platform, we may automatically collect:

  • IP address;
  • Device type, browser type, and operating system;
  • Usage data and interaction logs;
  • Referral URLs;
  • Cookies and similar tracking technologies.

3.3 Data from Third Parties

We may receive data from:

  • Payment processors;
  • Identity verification providers;
  • Analytics services;
  • Security and fraud-prevention partners.

4. How We Use Your Data

Beelia processes personal data in a structured and purpose-limited manner. We only use personal data where it is necessary, relevant, and proportionate to the operation of the Platform.

Specifically, we use personal data to:

  • Operate, maintain, and technically administer the Platform;
  • Enable account creation, login, and authentication;
  • Provide access to Platform features, tools, and services;
  • Manage waitlists, onboarding flows, and early access programs;
  • Verify creator identity, eligibility, and compliance with Platform requirements;
  • Facilitate payments, subscriptions, refunds (where applicable), and payouts through third-party payment providers;
  • Communicate with you regarding updates, security notices, product changes, or support requests;
  • Monitor Platform activity to ensure safety, integrity, and compliance with our Terms of Service;
  • Detect, prevent, and investigate fraud, abuse, misuse, or security incidents;
  • Analyze usage trends to improve functionality, performance, and user experience;
  • Enforce legal rights and comply with applicable laws, regulations, or lawful requests.

We do not use personal data for purposes that are incompatible with the reasons it was collected.

5. Legal Bases for Processing (GDPR)

For users located in the European Union or European Economic Area, Beelia processes personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Our legal bases for processing include:

  • Consent: Where you have explicitly consented to the processing of your personal data, such as when joining a waitlist or subscribing to communications.
  • Contractual necessity: Where processing is required to perform a contract with you or to take steps at your request prior to entering into a contract (e.g., account creation, access to services).
  • Legal obligation: Where processing is necessary to comply with legal or regulatory obligations, including financial, tax, or record-keeping requirements.
  • Legitimate interests: Where processing is necessary for our legitimate interests, such as securing the Platform, preventing fraud, improving services, and ensuring operational continuity, provided those interests are not overridden by your rights.

You may contact us for additional information regarding the specific legal basis applicable to particular processing activities.

6. Cookies and Tracking Technologies

Beelia uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to support the functionality, security, and performance of the Platform.

6.1 Types of Cookies

We may use:

  • Strictly necessary cookies to enable core Platform functionality and security;
  • Preference cookies to remember user settings;
  • Analytics cookies to understand how users interact with the Platform;
  • Security cookies to detect suspicious or abusive activity.

6.2 Cookie Management

You may manage or disable cookies through your browser or device settings. Please note that disabling certain cookies may limit functionality or availability of parts of the Platform.

7. Data Sharing and Disclosure

Beelia does not sell personal data.

We may share personal data in limited circumstances, including:

  • With service providers who perform services on our behalf (such as hosting, analytics, payment processing, identity verification, and security monitoring);
  • With identity verification and fraud-prevention partners for creator onboarding and risk mitigation;
  • With legal or regulatory authorities where disclosure is required by law, court order, or governmental request;
  • In connection with corporate transactions, such as mergers, acquisitions, restructurings, or asset transfers, subject to appropriate safeguards.

All third parties are contractually required to process personal data only for authorized purposes and in accordance with applicable data protection laws.

8. International Data Transfers

Beelia operates as a global platform. As a result, personal data may be transferred to, stored in, or processed in countries other than your country of residence, including countries outside the European Economic Area (EEA).

Such transfers may occur, for example, when:

  • We use cloud hosting, infrastructure, or analytics providers with servers located outside your jurisdiction;
  • We engage identity verification, payment processing, or security partners that operate internationally;
  • Users or creators access the Platform from different regions.

Where personal data is transferred outside the EEA, Beelia ensures that appropriate safeguards are in place to protect your data, which may include:

  • Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission;
  • Transfers to countries deemed to provide an adequate level of data protection;
  • Other lawful transfer mechanisms permitted under applicable data protection laws.

We take reasonable steps to ensure that international data transfers do not undermine the level of protection afforded to personal data under this Privacy Policy.

9. Data Retention

Beelia retains personal data only for as long as it is reasonably necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this Privacy Policy, to operate the Platform effectively, and to comply with legal, regulatory, and contractual obligations.

Retention periods are determined based on multiple factors, including:

  • The type and sensitivity of the data;
  • The purpose for which the data was collected;
  • Whether the data is required to maintain an active account;
  • Legal, accounting, or reporting obligations;
  • Security, fraud prevention, and audit requirements.

By way of example:

  • Account and profile data is retained for as long as an account remains active and for a reasonable period thereafter;
  • Transaction, payout, and financial records may be retained for longer periods as required by tax and accounting laws;
  • Security logs and risk signals may be retained to protect the Platform and its users;
  • Support communications may be retained to resolve disputes or improve services.

When personal data is no longer required, Beelia takes steps to securely delete, anonymize, or aggregate such data in accordance with industry standards.

10. Data Security

Beelia takes the security of personal data seriously and implements a combination of technical, organizational, and administrative safeguards designed to protect data against unauthorized access, loss, misuse, alteration, or disclosure.

These measures may include:

  • Access controls and authentication mechanisms;
  • Encryption of data in transit and, where appropriate, at rest;
  • Monitoring and logging of Platform activity;
  • Internal policies governing data access and handling;
  • Regular review and improvement of security practices.

Despite these efforts, no method of transmission or storage is completely secure. You acknowledge that the transmission of personal data over the internet involves inherent risks, and Beelia cannot guarantee absolute security.

11. Your Rights

Depending on your jurisdiction and applicable data protection laws, you may have certain rights regarding your personal data.

These rights may include:

  • Right of access: to obtain confirmation as to whether personal data concerning you is being processed and to access that data;
  • Right to rectification: to request correction of inaccurate or incomplete personal data;
  • Right to erasure: to request deletion of personal data, subject to legal and contractual limitations;
  • Right to restriction: to request limitation of processing in certain circumstances;
  • Right to object: to object to processing based on legitimate interests;
  • Right to data portability: to receive certain personal data in a structured, commonly used format;
  • Right to withdraw consent: at any time, where processing is based on consent;
  • Right to lodge a complaint: with a competent data protection authority.

To exercise your rights, you may contact Beelia using the details provided below. We may request additional information to verify your identity before responding. Requests will be handled within the timeframes required by law.

12. Children's Privacy

Beelia is designed to be accessible to a broad audience, including minors. We take additional care when processing personal data relating to children.

Where required by applicable law, Beelia relies on parental or legal guardian consent for the processing of personal data of minors. We do not knowingly collect or process personal data from children beyond what is necessary to provide access to the Platform.

If you believe that personal data relating to a child has been collected or processed without appropriate consent or in violation of applicable laws, please contact us so that we can take appropriate action.

13. Changes to This Policy

Beelia may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in legal requirements, technological developments, Platform features, or data processing practices.

When changes are material, we will provide notice through the Platform or by other means where required by law. The "Last updated" date at the top of this Policy will be revised accordingly.

Your continued use of the Platform after an updated Privacy Policy becomes effective constitutes acknowledgment and acceptance of the revised Policy.

14. Contact Information

If you have questions, requests, or concerns regarding this Privacy Policy or your personal data, please contact:

Email: support@beelia.ai

By using Beelia, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy.
